briefdescription.para: attribute index (derived from attribute name in startRender)
hashtable for faster access to symbols
Constructor for QgsCategorizedSymbolRenderer.

detaileddescription.para: The attrName argument specifies the layer's field name, or expression, which the categories will be matched against.
A list of renderer categories can optionally be specified. If no categories are specified in the constructor, they can be added later by calling addCategory().

briefdescription.para: Adds a new category to the renderer.
Returns details about internals of this renderer.

detaileddescription.para: E.g. if you only want to deal with visible features:

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of all categories recognized by the renderer.
Returns the index of the category with the specified label (or -1 if the label was not found, or is not unique).
Returns the index for the category with the specified value (or -1 if not found).
item in symbology was checked
Returns the class attribute for the renderer, which is the field name or expression string from the layer which will be matched against the renderer categories.
Create a deep copy of this renderer.

detaileddescription.para: Should be implemented by all subclasses and generate a proper subclass.

briefdescription.para: Returns configuration of appearance of legend when using data-defined size for marker symbols.

detaileddescription.para:
Will return null if the functionality is disabled.
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Deletes all existing categories from the renderer.
Deletes the category with the specified index from the renderer.
Returns debug information about this renderer.
If a renderer does not require all the features this method may be overridden and return an expression used as where clause.

detaileddescription.para: This will be called once after startRender() and before the first call to renderFeature(). By default this returns a null string and all features will be requested. You do not need to specify the extent in here, this is taken care of separately and will be combined with a filter returned from this method.

simplesect.para: An expression used as where clause

briefdescription.para: Returns true if this renderer requires the geometry to apply the filter.
If supported by the renderer, return classification attribute for the use in legend.
Returns legend keys matching a specified feature.
items of symbology items in legend is checked
Returns a list of symbology items for the legend.
items of symbology items in legend should be checkable

memberdef.argsstring: (QgsStyle *style, QgsSymbol::SymbolType type, QVariantList &unmatchedCategories, QStringList &unmatchedSymbols, bool caseSensitive=true, bool useTolerantMatch=false)
memberdef.name: matchToSymbols

briefdescription.para: Replaces category symbols with the symbols from a style that have a matching name and symbol type.

detaileddescription.para: The unmatchedCategories list will be filled with all existing categories which could not be matched to a symbol in style.
The unmatchedSymbols list will be filled with all symbol names from style which were not matched to an existing category.
If caseSensitive is false, then a case-insensitive match will be performed. If useTolerantMatch is true, then non-alphanumeric characters in style and category names will be ignored during the match.
Returns the count of symbols matched.

briefdescription.para: Moves an existing category at index position from to index position to.
Returns symbol for feature.

detaileddescription.para:
The difference compared to symbolForFeature() is that it returns original symbol which can be used as an identifier for renderer's rule - the former may return a temporary replacement of a symbol for use in rendering.
QGIS 2.12

briefdescription.para: store renderer info to XML element
Sets the class attribute for the renderer, which is the field name or expression string from the layer which will be matched against the renderer categories.
Configures appearance of legend when renderer is configured to use data-defined size for marker symbols.

detaileddescription.para: This allows configuring for which values (symbol sizes) should be shown in the legend, whether to display different symbol sizes collapsed in one legend node or separated across multiple legend nodes etc.

When renderer does not use data-defined size or does not use marker symbols, these settings will be ignored. Takes ownership of the passed settings objects. Null pointer is a valid input that disables data-defined size legend.
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Sets the symbol to be used for a legend symbol item.

parameterdescription.para: new symbol for legend item. Ownership is transferred to renderer.

briefdescription.para: Sets the source color ramp.

parameterdescription.para: color ramp. Ownership is transferred to the renderer

briefdescription.para: Sets the source symbol for the renderer, which is the base symbol used for the each categories' symbol before applying the categories' color.

parameterdescription.para: source symbol, ownership is transferred to the renderer

briefdescription.para: Sorts the existing categories by their label.
Sorts the existing categories by their value.
Returns the source color ramp, from which each categories' color is derived.
Returns the renderer's source symbol, which is the base symbol used for the each categories' symbol before applying the categories' color.
Must be called when a new render cycle is started.

detaileddescription.para: A call to startRender() must always be followed by a corresponding call to stopRender() after all features have been rendered.

parameterdescription.para: Additional information passed to the renderer about the job which will be rendered

simplesect.para: This method is not thread safe. Before calling startRender() in a non-main thread, the renderer should instead be cloned and startRender()/stopRender() called on the clone.

briefdescription.para: Must be called when a render cycle has finished, to allow the renderer to clean up.

detaileddescription.para: Calls to stopRender() must always be preceded by a call to startRender().

simplesect.para: This method is not thread safe. Before calling startRender() in a non-main thread, the renderer should instead be cloned and startRender()/stopRender() called on the clone.

briefdescription.para: To be overridden.

detaileddescription.para:
Must be called between startRender() and stopRender() calls.
feature
feature
context
render context
returns pointer to symbol or 0 if symbol was not found
QGIS 2.12

briefdescription.para: Returns list of symbols used by the renderer.
used from subclasses to create SLD Rule elements following SLD v1.1 specs
Changes the label for the category with the specified index.

detaileddescription.para: A category's label is used to represent the category within legends and the layer tree.

briefdescription.para: Changes the render state for the category with the specified index.

detaileddescription.para: The render state indicates whether or not the category will be rendered, and is reflected in whether the category is checked with the project's layer tree.

briefdescription.para: Changes the symbol for the category with the specified index.

detaileddescription.para: Ownership of symbol is transferred to the renderer.

briefdescription.para: Changes the value for the category with the specified index.

detaileddescription.para: If value is a list, then the category will match any of the values from this list.

briefdescription.para: Update the color ramp used and all symbols colors.

parameterdescription.para: color ramp. Ownership is transferred to the renderer

briefdescription.para: Update all the symbols but leave categories and colors.

detaileddescription.para:
This method also sets the source symbol for the renderer.
sym
source symbol to use for categories. Ownership is not transferred.
setSourceSymbol()

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of attributes required by this renderer.

detaileddescription.para: Attributes not listed in here may not have been requested from the provider at rendering time.

briefdescription.para: creates a QgsCategorizedSymbolRenderer from an existing renderer.

simplesect.para: a new renderer if the conversion was possible, otherwise 0.

briefdescription.para: Creates a categorized renderer from an XML element.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QVariantList &values, const QgsSymbol *symbol, QgsVectorLayer *layer=nullptr, const QString &fieldName=QString())
memberdef.name: createCategories

briefdescription.para: Create categories for a list of values.

detaileddescription.para: The returned symbols in the category list will be a modification of symbol.
If layer and fieldName are specified it will try to find nicer values to represent the description for the categories based on the respective field configuration.

xrefdescription.para: No longer used, will be removed in QGIS 4.0

briefdescription.para: Returns the matching symbol corresponding to an attribute value.

xrefdescription.para: use variant which takes a second bool argument instead.

briefdescription.para: Returns the matching symbol corresponding to an attribute value.

detaileddescription.para: Will return nullptr if no matching symbol was found for value, or if the category corresponding to value is currently disabled (see QgsRendererCategory::renderState()).

If foundMatchingSymbol is specified then it will be set to true if a matching category was found. This can be used to differentiate between a nullptr returned as a result of no matching category vs a nullptr as a result of disabled categories.

simplesect.para: available in Python bindings as symbolForValue2

briefdescription.para: Returns list of legend symbol items from individual categories.
Returns calculated classification value for a feature.
